title: Good, technical showcase, not perfect
comment: Quick note: you need a Reicast-optimized BIOS. Your standard DC BINs will just crash the app. As for the app, it's a real technical test. Wide array of settings, gamepad support, and of course, portable! Sonic Adventure 2 is exciting to play on it. Of course, there are graphical defects you can expect for most other games, and the "analog" pad never goes directly forward. Still, a functional app and a good test of your hardware.

title: Reicast: Now the only worthwhile Dreamcast Emulator. Period.
comment: Even as a successor to NullDC, it is FAR more easy to use than that product wished it could be. And even for an Android based program, it's one of the best of it's kind. And even for a supposed ALPHA, it's fantastic at what it does and only has a few losses in game compatibility that, especially this early in development, are sure to be resolved soon. Anyone with even a passing interest in Dreamcast games, this is a must.

title: Awesome app, though it has minor issues.
comment: for those with problems trying to place the dc_boot and dc_flash bins in it's place, I had to put them in /sdcard/reicast/data folder BUT also I had to duplicate it (copy the data folder) and make another new folder called dc in /sdcard so the app would find the dc_boot and dc_flash bins. Best first dreamcast app nonetheless, only problem I have though was the fmv sequences stutter a lot, at least playing Air Force Delta, not sure if other games'll do that... my device is samsung note pro 12.2 running stock 4.4.2.  UPDATE: spoke too soon, the whole pad crashes on demolition racer - no exit, on the car selection screen after the locale.

title: TUTORIAL
comment: In your file manager make a folder called dc inside dc make data. Search google for dreamcast bios download the bios. Install zarchive or any file managers with extraction.Go to zarchive extract the bios file to data.download roms in emuparadise or coolrom.if the rom is a rar file extract it with zarchive.go to reicast choose paths arrange the paths.          Boot the bios file arrange the time.             For those who have problems with reicast vibrating go to input and turn off  touch vibration

title: Here's the Solution to use this App
comment: Go to Google and put in dreamcast bios download then you have to download Astro file manager app find the dcbios.zip file. hold down on it go to extract here it will make a new file called (dc) in it are all the bio files. When you go back to reicast go to paths, make the first browser thing go to the dc folder and set it to the data file. Then all you need is games. When you have games get the ZArchiver app find your games on the app and extract them. From what I figured you don't need the zip file after.

title: 4HELP-READ THIS!
comment: After installing you will have to.... 1. Download ES file explorer 2. Google DC bios and flash 3. Download DC bios and flash files if you don't know how to dump bios or flash, go to YouTube or find another way 3. Make DC folder on micro SD card ( your SD card can be found by going to ROOT>MNT>SD CARD 1 or EXT SD) if you're still lost, go to Google or YouTube or me 4. Create new folder and name it DC than create a new folder within the DC folder and name it data 5. Unzip bios and flash files n rename them

title: EASY How to Get it Working:
comment: Get "Every BIOS" + "FX File Explorer" Apps. Open Every BIOS. Tap Unzipped>Dreamcast>DC - BIOS.bin>WEB. Open FX, find '/Download/DC - BIOS.bin'. Swipe on file to select. Tap "cut". In FX App go to '/storage/emulated/0/dc' folder. Then tap "clipboard" + "paste". **** NOW SELECT AND RENAME 'DC - BIOS.bin' to 'dc_boot.bin' **** Finally in Reicast, tap Path>Storage>Browse>(folder where DC games are on phone). (Extract games w/ Easy Unrar into folder you selected.) Now pick a game and PLAY!!

title: Great app
comment: I've had the same problem others have had where it crashes when you put the bios in the folder, here's what to do, create a folder on your phone root folder called "dc" then in that folder create another folder call it "data" in this folder put your bios in there, once done you can test it by running the bios. You will know it works once you see the system logo starts up. You can put the rom folder anywhere but for some strange reason bios only works from the root or main phone storage. Hope this helps.

title: I would give it 5 stars...
comment: ...if it described what to do a little better. To anyone who is confused, you will need to download a file browser like es file explorer. Create a folder named dc in storage/emulated/0, and another folder within that named data. Google search "reicast bios" and click the first link. Download the bios and move both dc_bios and dc_flash to the data folder, and you should be good to go as far as bios goes. If your game starts playing the very beginning but exits without getting to gameplay, the file is faulty.

title: way way better than expected, and totally real
comment: A bit of futzing around with folders to get it to recognize both the flash and the bios (Whavever ones you download, you have to rename them to EXACTLY "dc_bios.bin" and "dc_flash.bin", no other filename will work) but after that, it runs Sonic Adventure really well out of the gate.   Framerate is not perfect, it will start chugging at certain points, and the textures are buggy in many places, but it's entirely playable and actually runs much better than any DC emu I've tried on my PC.   If the dev keeps updating and making it better, this looks like a soon-to-be must have app.

title: Almost 5 stars
comment: This is a great app, especially considering the fact it's emulating the Dreamcast and fairly new. There are 2 things that stop me from giving it that extra star, and it's only because I'm spoilt from ePSxe.  1. Exiting the app via the Home button quits the game without warning. Every once in awhile I'll accidentally hit it (or hit it on purpose, forgetting it doesn't work the same way ePSxe does), losing a ton of progress. (In case anyone doesn't know how ePSxe works, it remembers the state the game was in after you leave the app, allowing you to restore the game the next time you come back.)  2. Save states. This is mainly only a problem because of the first one. With ePSxe I had 3 options if I wanted to take a break or do something else quickly on my phone. Find a save point (not as easy in most games), save states or close the game and restore it later, keeping my progress. With Reicast my only option is to find a save point, which are scarce. Unlike the actual consoles these emulators emulate, there's usually countless times you have to urgently close the app due to phone calls or text messages.  It's still a really great app and definitely worth getting, though.

title: The awesome Dreamcast playable on Android
comment: The Dreamcast is one of my all time favourite consoles, so I was curious to see how well this actually works, if at all.Well, after the initial setup of the folders and so on, it almost bought a tear to my eye to see the blue startup swirl of the Dreamcast on my PipoS1, and amazingly it's already at a very advanced stage of development and able to play lots of games.I'm never going to part with my Dreamcast collection, but it's incredible to have it effectively reduced to an app that I can play anywhere.

In the meantime add some game specific controller layouts that you can customize (scale/opacity/rotation/orientation) for games like Shenmue then playing Ikagura. Also able to use analog stick as movement, the dpad is very "late" (I'm on an HTC One.) The input latency isn't accurate/off, but really Is love to see some more customization/profiles for co stroller layouts, it would be perfect. Good luck on your work.

title: Lacking very basic features
comment: The emulator does great where many fall short and has a hardworking developer who is hardworking, however this emulator falls short of having even a basic pause feature. You cannot leave your phone unattended, if it goes to sleep, emulator shuts down. If you want to read that text you jus got whilst playing, shuts down. This thing NEEDS someway to run in the background, otherwise unless you can set aside a completely undisturbed amount of time in your day to play, it's almost not worth having.

title: Very Good for a Work in Progress
comment: This emulator takes a bit of work to set up. I highly recommend looking up how best to name the folders and dc_bios.bin and dc_flash.bin and follow the instructions completely. It'll make things go much more smoothly. I'd also recommend putting your ROMs in the same folder as these. This makes setting your paths that much easier. With that said, on with the review. I've really only played Shenmue at any length so far, though I have briefly tried a few other games to test out how well they work. Shenmue works great for the most part. There are some graphical glitches that come up frequently, like this weir, creepy thing that happens with Ryo's eyes. Besides that, the game runs smoothly. Framerate is consistent and never drops, load times are as good as they were on Dreamcast and everything seems to work fine so far.  The only complaint I would make is with the games that don't work. I wasn't able to run several of them so far. SKies of Arcadia, Omikron, Time Stalkers and Stupid Invaders so far. This is to be expected with a work in progress. All things considered, I am very impressed with this and look forward to improvements down the road. Keep up the good work!

title: Amazing.
comment: Granted the only game I've played on it is Mortal Kombat Gold, but it runs (and I know this is a horrible pun) flawlessly. 60FPS at 1080p on my HTC One M8 (stock) and my Ouya (running CM11).  One thing to note, and I know this is alpha but I thought it was weird - on the One M8, all videos played fine and the "widescreen mode" displayed the extra geometry (just like on nullDC), but on the Ouya, videos only show as 4 faint "polygons" and widescreen mode does not show the extra geometry.  Having said that, this is simply amazing to have a Dreamcast emulator running this well on Android, especially on a Tegra 3 Ouya. Looking forward to updates.

title: Awesome emulator
comment: This is an awesome DC emulator , great work guys , the best DC emulator by a long way. Also to the people having trouble getting the emulator to work you have to rename the bios/flash files to the correct names.

title: Adding the bios
comment: I used total commander(free app) to create my folders Click the SD-card (should be on top) For the first step make a dc folder/ Inside of that folder you need to make two new folders: one named "data" and the other named "iso"/ inside data folder you need put in the bios and flash/ Then you need to rename the "dc_bios.bin" to "dc_boot.bin"/ Now go back to the iso folder that you made earlier and drag your games into that folder/ If you did it correctly you're games will work. Ps make sure NONE of the folder names or renamed bios are in CAPS and if youve already tried and got the missing bios message you may need to uninstall then reinstall the reicast app before following the steps above

title: Great! better than expected.
comment: I avoided this emu for awhile as I thought "Dreamcast will probably run choppy, with no sound, and be unplayable on a mobile device".  I was WRONG, it actually runs smooth, with sound, and controls great on the Nvidia Shield.  Even the analog stick works as an analog,  the triggers work, and the button layout happens to be the same as a Dreamcast controller.  When this gets further this emu will make the Nvidia Shield basically a portable Dreamcast.  The Shield seems the ideal device for this with the control layout and speed and they are pretty cheap now.  The only negative is the icons, I can't tell what the hell they do, the symbols are not very obvious , I just start hitting things until something happens, took a star off for that. Maybe make the icons user replaceable, I will do my own art that makes sense for me.  The other thing is depth fog is not implemented giving some odd graphics at times.  Great work otherwise though!

title: Incredible achievement
comment: I am amazed that we are now on the way to having a fully functioning dreamcast emulator.  Already games such as soul Caliber work beautifully, with sharp HD graphics.  I am also quite surprised how smoothly it works on my rooted nook hd+.  If you are having trouble with bios,  try this way.  - if you have already downloaded and installed,  delete it. - proceed to make the 'DC'folder and place the 'data' folder inside (per instructions )  - place your bios as instructed  - (optional) place games in the DC folder - reinstall - configure paths to these correct folders  This worked for me,  hope it helps you!   Keep up the good work guys!

title: If you cant get it to run=
comment: If the emulator keeps telling you it cant find the bios and flash files, rename dc_bios to dc_boot, create a folder called 'DC' (without quotes) on the root of your devices internal memory card, or the root of whatever memory Reicast is installed to, then within that folder, create another called 'Data' (without quotes). Then place your flash and bios in that folder. Job done.

title: Getting better and better
comment: This is great but since the update I can't get it to work with the BT controller app.that's OK I'm using an otg cable with a controller but it be nice for multiplayer.for the people saying that they have downloaded the proper boot files and still can't get it to run here's a hint you have to rename the boot file to "dc_boot.bin" .without quotes.it may be named differently like "dc_bios.bin".I myself had to change the file name when I used the any bios emulator app.I can almost guarantee that this is the problem most people are having.i also had to change the language cause the bios where in Spanish you can change that by running the bios and changing it in settings.there are other ways of getting the proper files without having to rename them but idk if I can mention them.my way is easier anyway.

title: A Fantastic Emulator For An Alpha!
comment: First of all, this is an alpha build.  It is to be expected that it still requires a lot of polish and bug fixes.  That being said, this is a fantastic and very promising emulator thus far.  Just in the last few updates, we've seen some dramatic improvements to performance and user interface.  It takes a powerful device to run properly though.  Even an Nvidia Shield can chug at times.   Issues I've encountered: -Gamepad mapping isn't consistent -UI, while improved, is still a bit unintuitive.  Icons are too vague. -Mild graphical glitches that make some polygons seep through one another   Looking forward to seeing what the future holds for Reicast and in the meantime, enjoying some DC classics!

title: Works beautifully on Galaxy Mega
comment: R6 has a bunch of problems on the Galaxy Mega, the default setting causes an instant hard reset of the Mega when trying to load even the boot menu. This issue is now resolved, I have found a workaround, use the following settings:  Unstable Opts: Off; Mipmaps: On; Frameskip: 0; Software Rendering: Off; Dynarec: ON; Limit FPS: ON;  (non-performace settings dont affect this issue).  Consequently Reicast is running beautifully, regularly getting 49-55 fps in the 15 titles I've tried, back up to 5 stars!!!!
Samsung is to blame for the reboots, they pushed a problematic kernel update. We're looking for a work around on our side, but It doesn't seem like there's anything that can be done right now.

title: Needs more work, but so far EXCELLENT!!!!
comment: SIII, Note 10.1 2014, and Nvidia Shield runs this great. Keep in mind, that the Buttons are kind of hard to get a bearing on at first. R1 is the Start Button. L and R2 are the L/R Shoulders, but the A, B, X and Y buttons are what they would be on the actual DC. Some Games work with both the Digital and Analog Joysticks depending on what kind of Controller you have. Shield works with both, but Moga Hero only works with the Analog. Games that run perfectly with minor Graphics=== CapVSNK 1 and 2, NFL Blitz 2k and 2k1, and Marvel VS Capcom 2. Most of the Games I ran are in GDI Format. Hydro Thunder works in CDI Format if you can keep up with it. LOL. Runs VERY fast. MK Gold runs, but there are no Analog/Digital Control. Also, for some reason there is no way to run CDX/GameShark, Action Replay, Ect. mainly because they will not load and also no way to change the Disks.

title: I Put bios in sdcard/dc/data
comment: Put bios in the location specified sdcard/dc/data...  I put my bios in that data folder.  your bios files need to be named dc_boot. bin  and the other needs to be named dc_flash. bin   ( my problem I had was because one of bios files was called dc_bios. bin which messed it up...  After renaming it to dc_boot. bin the app started seeing the bios file....

The proof is in front of you, there's only one developer making this emulator possible.  With that said I can't upload the bios because the gingerbread update puts my root file sdcard0 instead of sdcard.  Even though its mirrored and actually there it won't lemme load it.  If you could update on that it would appreciated so I could finally play lol but I have high hopes.  So I give four stars...for now

title: Diamond in the Rough.
comment: DEVELOPER: Tested on the Samsung Galaxy S4 Active (AT&T Carrier)!! REVIEW: So blindly I've played with this download. I missed my physical Dreamcast I've parted ways with. So far, it is easy to understand. Of course the developer cannot tell you where to get ROMs or the BIOS files. It's a simple web search. Pros- Easy learning curve and easy to use, very playable content. Cons.  Thumb stick sensor is twitchy, some graphics in some games are a little glitchy, but overall this emulator, being in it's early stages, is about perfect. Need some options to tweak performance soon here, but, NILLWARE, please do not change the GUI! Focus on the bugs. Also, those who as also downloaded this and know how  to use it and like it/know how to use it.. please donate to this developer for providing this app ad free, and just free in general. I know I will. Keep it downloaded, and give these guys support. OPA!

title: Can't use on Note 3
comment: The app requests that the bios file be placed in a specific directory (a child directory of "sdcard"), but that directory does not exist on the Samsung Note 3 and many other devices.    The primary storage is "storage/emulated/0" and can't be changed without rooting. The app cannot be used at all because of this. I would recommend using a FileChooser to identify where the bios file is dynamically regardless of the device and environment for best compatibility. I'll give 5 stars after its fixed.
Check youtube some nice people have made videos on how to set it up :). The next version will be easier to use (and support custom paths)

title: Great work!
comment: To anyone having trouble with bios. Make sure 1. That you yourself creates the folders the emulator tells you to in your sd card. The emulator does NOT do it for you. And 2. Your bios are named dc_boot.bin NOT dc_bios.bin. if so you need to rename it! And 3. You need dc_flash.bin to go in the same data folder as well.

title: JXD S7800B AMAZING!
comment: It runs both Sonic Adventure 1 and 2 at full speed using firmware 1.1.14 at 1.42ghz (the system is supposed to be clocked at 1.6 stock but they have since changed the clocking in the second batch for some unknown reason). Sonic Adventure one seems to be basically flawless except for : - Video Cutscenes jitter a little (not much of a problem, who cares really?) -Writing in character selection menu disappears but shows up when the screen fades -Sonic's eyes have a little glitching sometimes. Flawless emulation other than that! No slowdown or choppy music! :)  Sonic Adventure 2 on the other hand runs full speed, but the gameplay keeps glitching up intensely when there seems to be too many polygons on screen. Still playable though, no slowdown or choppy music either. :)  Amazing emulator for alpha stage, buttons should be configurable (start button is configured to Left shoulder button and start button on my system sends me back to home screen, ugh), full screen support and save state support, fix what makes the small graphical glitches and it is basically perfect for me! Keep the good work!:)

title: Awesome.
comment: Works great for the first beta. Currently running this on HTC EVO 4G. For all those who having trouble with the Boot and Flash files, this is what you need to do.1st, make the required folders. 2nd, put the Boot and Flash that you dumped (or downloaded) into the folders. 3rd, launch Reicast and boot bios. That's it :)  Note: if you are still getting an error when launching Reicast, change the boot file with another one.

title: Amazing
comment: Thank you so much.this is wonderful :))

You need to dump and use the bios and flash files from your dreamcast. Reicast requires them.

They must be placed in the device as follows: /sdcard/dc/data/dc_boot.bin and /sdcard/dc/data/dc_flash.bin

title: A brilliant idea!!! we all need to support this dev!
comment: I have been waiting for a dreamcast emulator on android for some time now. Was following development on NullDCe (drkRaziel) but since the apk leak there has not been much news on that front.   I have installed this and dumped the bios and flash bin files but can not get the application to find the files that are put on the sdcard in the path mentioned by the developer. Think the issue is that my sdcard is actually called extSdCard? so the path is wrong in the eyes of the app?  I am testing the app on a samsung galaxy s3. I am giving the app 5 stars because i am supporting the developer and am sure the app works fine on other phones. So much looking forward to updates and seeing where this progresses! Want to play the best games ever on this emulator! Shenmue and Shenmue 2!!!!  Everyone please support this developer we need to thing to progress!   Thank you so much developer.   Asam  Update: Just realised that this is by drkRaziel!!! You legend!!! Thank you so much for keeping this going!!! I know this things gonna get better!  Update: Worked it out, basically silly samsung file explorer, you need to use EZ File Explorer and you can then see the sdcard mount point folder. Its now booting into the app so will play with it and update!!!
